title.narrative: 3A W/C Africa Air Transport Phase II-B

description.narrative: The Project Development Objectives are as follows: (i) improve national Civil Aviation Authorities' (CAAs') compliance with International Civil Aviation Organization's (ICAO's) safety standards, (ii) increase national CAA's compliance with ICAO's security standards, and (iii) enhance main international airports' compliance with ICAO's securtity standards.

condition.narrative: Submit to the Association no later than sone (1) month after the effective Date the report of the Recipient's public accountant ont he 2006 and 2007 financial statements of the ANAC.
The ANAC shall ensure carry out annual airport-crisis simulation exercises.
The ANAC shall submit to the Association a report describing the results of airport crisis sumulation exercises
The ANAC shall submit to the Association quarterly reports containing information relating to the rate of seizure of illegalobjects from passengers.
The ANAC shall submit to the Association, no later than 18 months after the Effective Date and six (6) months prior to the ClosingD ate, ICAO safety and security audit reports.
The ANACS shall carry out annual airport-crisis simulation exercises.
The ANACS shall submit to the Association a report describing the results of airport crisis sumulation exercises.
The ANACS shall submit to the Association quarterly reports containing information relating to the rate of seizure of illegalobject s from passengers.
The ANACS shall submit to the Association, no later than 18 months after the Effective Date and six (6) months prior to theClosingDate, ICAO safety and security audit reports.
The Recipient shall submit to the Association no later than six (6) months after the end of each FY, a report, on the use of theRec ipient's Airport Security Fee.
The Recipient shall submit to the Association no later than six (6) months after the end of each FY, independently auditedfinancial reports on the activities of the ANAC
The Recipient shall submit to the Association no later than six (6) months after the end of each FY, independently auditedfinancial reports on the activities of the ANACS.
The Recipient shall submit to the Association, mid-term and end of the Project security and safety audits.
The Recipient shall submit to the Association, mid-term and end of the Project security and safety audits.
The Recipient shall submit to the Association, no later than 3 months prior to the mid-term review, a report integrating theresult s of the monitoring of the activities performed.
The Recipient shall submit to the Association, no later than 3 months prior to the mid-term review, a report integrating theresult s of the monitoring of the activities performed.
The Recipient shall, in conjunction with the Association and the ANAC, carry out a mid-term review of the Project.
The Recipient shall, in conjunction with the Association and the ANACS, carry out a mid-term review of the Project.
